Author: ca333#0118
Content: yes its an operating system limitation. Unlike android its pretty tough to get an app approved with "unusual" background operation times. VOIP apps for example are allowed to operate in the background and theres even a special flag for this. I guess Apple thinks users may associate this with "iphone is crap" since it could drain the battery VERY fast if an app runs longterm in the background. Right now you could extend the background runtime to a max of ~3 minutes according to various documentations. We will work on optimizing this and eventually find a good solution (even if we had to integrate a real VOIP chat functinoality at some point of time to bypass apples rules)

Content: Reminder: This is a beta program which means we are testing new innovative technology - we are the first in the world to do this. This privilege also brings certain expected risks (application crashs, unknown bugs,...). This is normal when using brand new software. Please do not use this application with big amounts - dont deposit more than you are willing to lose during these tests. Thank you.
